name: Puffy Island Puff Quilt Pattern
description:
Learn how to make a puff quilt with a machine! 

Sew this adorable puff quilt that combines both puff quilting (or biscuit quilting) and traditional flat quilting. Final quilt size is 40x33 but includes calculations for making larger sizes. Full color tutorial of 41 steps, 19 pages. Beginner to Intermediate Level. You can do this!!

Follow my blog www.honeybearlane.com for updates and news as well as promotions and giveaways for this tutorial.

This is a PDF that will be sent to your email address automatically.

name: Twin Size or Larger Puff Quilt Pattern
description:
Want to make a Twin size or larger puff quilt?  It's much easier with this pattern, which uses slightly larger puffs and a different backing method.  

This puff quilt tutorial is very comprehensive, so even if you are a beginner, intermediate, or experienced sewer, you will be able to create a beautiful twin size puff quilt! Full color photos.

As a bonus, this quilt skips the binding step so if you are intimidated by binding, you don't have to worry about it here!

Follow my blog www.honeybearlane.com for updates and news as well as promotions and giveaways for this tutorial.

This is a PDF that will be sent to your email address automatically.

name: Rag Puff Quilt Tutorial (Printable)
description:
Learn to sew a puff quilt with a sewing machine!  Traditionally these quilts have been sewn by hand, taking hours, days, and weeks to create something that you can now make in a matter of days!  

This quilt is the ultra-simple version of the puff quilt, with no border, backing, or binding to worry about.  One side has a rag (fringed) finish and the other side is finished.    

This tutorial is very comprehensive, so even if you are a beginner, intermediate, or experienced sewer, you will be able to create a beautiful baby size puff quilt!  17 pages, 20 steps, full color pictures.  

The tutorial makes a 42x27 puff quilt, which fits the top of a baby mattress, short about 10 inches in length.  The pattern includes a page of calculations if you want to make a bigger size. 

Follow my blog www.honeybearlane.com for updates and news as well as promotions and giveaways for this tutorial. 

This is a PDF file.  You should receive a link for an instant download. Please make sure that the email attached to your PayPal account is current.  Thank you!!

This is the printable version of the PDF.  You may purchase a much smaller file to be stored on your computer under Puff Quilt Tutorial:  PDF (digital)

name: Puff Quilt Tutorial: PDF Printable Version
description:
Learn to sew a puff quilt with a sewing machine!  Traditionally these quilts have been sewn by hand, taking hours, days, and weeks to create something that you can now make in a matter of days!  

This tutorial is very comprehensive, so even if you are a beginner, intermediate, or experienced sewer, you will be able to create a beautiful baby size puff quilt!  57 pages, 50 steps.  

The tutorial makes a 36x36 puff quilt, but includes a page of calculations if you want to make a bigger size. Tip on choosing fabrics and cutting are also included!  

Follow my blog www.honeybearlane.com for updates and news as well as promotions and giveaways for this tutorial.

name: Limited Production License
description:
This is a Limited Production License that allow you to sell items made from Honeybear Lane patterns. The production is unlimited as long as all clothing made from the patterns is sewn in your own home without any type of commercial production. The contract prohibits any commercial or manufacturer large-scale production sewing or any outside help including employees or contractors.

When you purchase this listing you will be sent the forms within 24 hours to the email on the Paypal account, please make sure the email is accurate.

The license is not valid until the form is physically scanned and emailed or mailed.

Basic license details:

This is a lifetime license, does not require renewal.

Any minor changes to the dimensions of the item must be specified to the customer before the sale has taken place but doesn't need the  approval of Honeybear Lane.

The production is unlimited as long as all items made from the patterns are sewn in your own home without any type of commercial production. 

You must include the text for each item created using the pattern:

“This item was created using a Honeybear Lane pattern and is sold under a Limited Production License from Honeybear Lane.” Hyperlinks to the pattern or www.honeybearlane.com should be provided where applicable if you are an online retailer.

The sewing license is non-transferable and non-refundable. This license may not be sold, gifted, or in any other way be transferred to another person/business and refunds will not be given under any circumstances.
